p: IDSR weekly cases of under-5 diarrhea in Chobe District exhibited strong seasonal dynamics over the decade of observation (2007â€“2017), with 2 outbreaks occurring regularly each year ( Fig 2). The first outbreak period occurred on average in late January during the wet season, and the second, in August during the dry season. The diarrheal attack rate was greater, on average, for dry season outbreaks (average number of cases = 615, SD = 333) than for wet season outbreaks (average number of cases = 407, SD = 232). The number of outpatient diarrhea cases reported per month (all ages) for the same area exhibited a similar seasonal pattern. As with under-5 diarrhea, the all-age outpatient attack rate tended to be higher on average in the dry season (average = 725, SD = 381) than in the wet season (average = 466, SD = 226).
